#Respondent file create id
```{r}
'%ni%' <- Negate('%in%')

class(h16_R_all$PPN_SP)

#filter out not valid id
h16_R_all_id <- h16_R_all%>%
  filter(!is.na(PPN_SP))%>%
  filter(PPN_SP %ni% c("811", "812", "821", "831", "832", "841", "822"))%>%
  mutate(respondent_id= paste(HHID, PN, sep=""), spouse_id=paste(HHID, PPN_SP, sep=""))

```

#Join respondent with helper
```{r}
dyad <- left_join(h16_R_all_adl, helper_id, by = c("spouse_id"="respondent_id"))
class(dyad$Helper_Relationship)

dyad <- dyad %>%
  mutate(helper = if_else(Helper_Relationship == 2, "Y", "N"))

#A dataset that contains all the helpers who are also respondents
helper_also_respondent <- dyad %>%
  filter(helper== "Y")

#Prep dataset ready for join. Only include 2 variables
helper_also_respondent_id<-helper_also_respondent%>%
  select(respondent_id, helper)

#Join
dyad_couple <- left_join(dyad, helper_also_respondent_id, by= c("spouse_id"="respondent_id" ))

#We are using both helper.x and helper.y to identify couples
dyad_couple <- dyad_couple%>%
  filter(helper.x=="Y" | helper.y =="Y")
```
